summary:
Change Management | Project Management | Transformation | Team leader| Result Oriented |Competitive Analysis I Coaching I Agile I Change and Adoption 

10+ years of experience working in the FMCG industry in the change management and trade marketing areas.
Responsible for developing and executing change management strategy in projects for HR and Sales. Skilled in Learning & Development, Organizational Design, Project Management and Talent Management.

Versatile professional, with a Master's degree in Business Administration - MBA (FIA University, Brazil), Bachelor of Business Administration (ESPM University, Brazil), and a PROSCI Change Practitioner Certification, besides other change management related courses and specializations. 
International experience gained through working and studying abroad. Fluent in Portuguese, English, and Spanish. Responsible for driving change and adoption for different types of projects and solving business issues, tracking change curve reactions and adoption of new ways of working to assure sustainability of new tools/processes without business disruption. 

Seeking to develop new partner relationships. Aiming to gain experience in Change Management, Project Management and HR. Developing business and change management strategies for different types of projects, from shared business services, to new systems, tools and organizational structures.

Hands-On Experience, focusing on the desired project adoption. Easy of working in teams, International Experience, Clear Precise Communicator,Comprehensive, Detail Oriented, and Leadership Skills. Ability to negotiate with clients and partners, coach and manage people.

Goals: Engage stakeholders at all levels of the organization and mentor teams to drive adoption and sustainment of the change.

Areas of Expertise:
# Change Management
# PMO
# Trade Marketing
#Shopper Marketing
#Competitive Analysis

EU National I Right to live and work
Do not hesitate to contact me:
Phone:+310615522861
Email:ju.wittlin@gmail.com
Location: Utrecht, Netherlands

awards.title: Galaxy Award
awards.description: Highest recognition prize for the leading and execution of the change management strategy for the GBS project

awards.title: Encore
awards.description: Award for the launching of Johnson's deodorant category

certifications.name: International Coaching Certification
certifications.authority: EMCC - European Mentoring and Coaching Council

profile_positions.description:
• Maintain and develop the leadership team by providing more than ten training sessions to over 60 managers and directors.
• Developing and implementing the change and communication strategy to transfer various activities from 6 functions to a global shared service (GBS) in 2 different locations.
• Coaching and supporting the different levels in the organization to deliver key messages and adopt the new ways of working.
• Liaise with the team to track the change curve per function using the change agents network.
• Understanding prospects critical business issues, neuroscience (Neuro Leadership Institute – SCARF model) capabilities to assist in the change adoption.
• Implementing the new P&L reporting system adoption strategy, which received 96.5% approval from respondents.
• Support change management capabilities in the NWE business unit directly and indirectly, with over 500 employees and 100 mapped impacts.
• Developing the change management strategy for the adoption to SAP TPM system, using the ADKAR model.
Achievements:
Galaxy award: highest prize as recognition of the change management strategy and implementation in GBS
All impacted functions by GBS achieved the acceptance stage in the change curve after 4 weeks from the announcement
profile_positions.title: Change Manager North West Europe

profile_positions.description:
• Leading change management activities in strategic projects for HR and Sales, while combining learning and development strategy.
• Managing stakeholders, from field sales force up to senior VPs (Sales and HR).
• Develop  change management strategy and execution for the HR Employee Service Back Office transference from Brazil to Mexico.
• Leading the adoption of new ways of working through sales automation and go to market transformation projects using Agile (SAFe methodology).

Achievements:
More than 90% of accuracy in the first month implementation of new Employee Services Back Office in Mexico
More than 200 people trained and ready to adopt a new ways of working in the field sales force
84% of the end users achieved the commited and adoption stages in the change curve
Development and facilitation of the Change Management training for business areas, with 94% of trainees’ approval
Change Management certified by Pepsico – Latam
Agile Practitioner- SAFe Certified
profile_positions.title: HR Change Management Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
• Implementing the trade marketing strategy for cookies and crackers, Pepsico's Brazil second biggest market category, strategic alliances with internal and external stakeholders, and communications at the point of sales
• Identify and execute improvements for processes, products development, and launching strategy.
• Preparing category and sales team's budget as well as training, and market analysis (Nielsen and Kantar).
• Provide competitive analysis, project management, and people management for PepsiCo.
• Analyzing market trends, customer behavior, and competitive landscape.
• Liaise with sales, marketing, finances, and supply chain team to prepare reports, define category strategy and sales target definition.

Achievements:
Development of a customized strategy per geographical region
Launch of more than 2 new products and definition of innovation sales strategy for many other launches to come
profile_positions.title: Trade Marketing Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
• Create a Trade Marketing strategy and execute it for the personal care category, with a focus on the two largest region of Brazil (Northeast and Center-West)
• Developing a complete framework for customized Trade Marketing by channel and region.
• Develop the Baby Dove strategy in the Northeast region of Brazil, to grow the product, increase revenues and improve results.
• Supporting brand actions while meeting with the team to develop a promotional strategy
• Analyze market trends (Nielsen and Kantar), sales budget to prioritize and establish promotional actions by region/customer.
• Analyse research data, and trends in order to combine marketing methods and increase sales.
Achievements:
Through the partnership with sales and a focused plan, we had a +3pp market share for the newly launched Baby Dove brand in the Northeast region.
profile_positions.title: Trade Marketing Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
• Developing an effective trade marketing plan focused on beauty advisors. Responsible for developing training programs and engagement actions for drugstores chains.
• Build relationship strategy focused on drugstores in the brazilian market.
• Working with the product, sales, operations, and other teams to promote products, develop new communications concepts, and increase revenue.
• Introduce a differentiated Incentive campaign, development, and results in accompaniment for ROC and Neutrogena brands.
• Leading the IMS data analysis, while scheduling events for the main drugstore chains nationwide, which capacitated more than 2000 people.
• Support the people development, by making materials for training, organizing internal workshops, and other activities.

Achievements:
Being the first person to assume this position and coordinate training sessions around Brazil with the main drugstore chains
profile_positions.title: Trade Marketing Analyst Beauty Advisor

profile_positions.description:
• Launch the deodorant category, developing the strategy and pipeline.
• Launching promotions, new products and  trade marketing plans' to increase market share and revenue for Johnson's personal care brand
• Coordinating and supporting marketing plans, while meeting with senior managers and reporting results.
• Being the lead and the SME for the promotional packages process, working to improve it and reduce the time with internal and external partners

Achievements:
Gold Encore award for the launch of the deodorant category
Reviewing and reducing the promotional package development process from 6 months to 3
profile_positions.title: Trade Marketing Analyst

profile_positions.description:
• Develop strong optimization strategies to boost the biggest personal care category that Johnson works with
•  Managing the project that reviewed and optimized 6 key processes of the trade marketing department
•  Leading of multi functional teams
•  Research and analysis of the beauty sales model

Achievements:
To be chosen in a trainee process with more than 22.000 applications
profile_positions.title: Customer Development Trainee

profile_positions.description:
• Preparing the new products' sales kit to help the sales team to present the launches to the customers
• Take ownership of the sales report and present findings to the global finance team.
• Liaise with other departments to gain a better understanding of supply chain, logistics, marketing.

Achievements:
Organization of the Latam Customer Development Best Practices fair,  all Latam countries representatives presented their innovations and exchanged with each other
profile_positions.title: Latin America Customer Development Intern

profile_positions.description:
• Collecting data on consumers, competitors, and the marketplace in the Latin America Region and consolidating information into actionable items, reports, and presentations.
• Understand business objectives, market data analysis, and reports based on Nielsen information.
• Compiling Reckitt Benckiser statistical data, using modern and traditional methods.
• Perform valid and reliable market research with specialized companies.
• Interpreting data, formulating reports, and making recommendations to the team.
• Evaluate groups and research results focused on C class 

Achievements:
Leading of the first C social class focused market research for Reckitt Benckiser Brazil
profile_positions.title: Latin America Media and Market Research Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: Contributor and volunteer for Projeto Dona Odette, a NGO that helps kids and elderly people from a poor region in São Paulo providing development activities and health assistance
